results.title: The Searching eye
results.creator_credit: Saul Bass and Associates and Saul Bass
results.brief_description: Deals with the art of seeing in terms of simple observation, perception of the normally unseen world through the aid of the camera and the inner vision of the eye and mind through imagination, aesthetic appreciation and knowledge. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: The Searchers [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Merian C. Cooper and John Ford
results.brief_description: Ethan Edwards (John Wayne) resolves to find his niece, abducted by Indians at the close of the Civil War. It is an odyssey which takes five years, by the end of which he plans to take revenge on the Indians for the friends and family he has lost. John Ford used sumptuous Monument Valley as a background for this his most poetic and complex western. Cast includes Vera Miles and a young Natalie Wood. Based on a novel by Alan Le May. A documentary written and directed by Nick Redman entitled, “A Turning of the earth: John Ford, John Wayne and ‘The Searchers’”, featuring outtakes, home movies and the original theatrical trailer precedes the film. Introduced by Patrick Wayne.

results.title: The Search for the golden boomerang
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Peter Luby
results.brief_description: Dramatisations of episodes from the long-running children’s radio serial of the 1940s, performed with kitschy aplomb, are juxtaposed with scenes of everyday life in early postwar urban Australia in such a way as to underline the racism and sexism of the time. Cast includes Jojn Flaus, Alistair Forge, Sue World, Don Munro, Jim Howard, Christine Kerner, Peter Lane.

results.title: The Search for oil - Indonesia
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Bert Haanstra
results.brief_description: Illustrates the methods by which geologists forecast the areas where deposits of oil are likely to be found. Set mainly in the jungles of Indonesia the film shows how map making, geological and gravimetric survey, seismic exploration and fossil interpretation are used to build up a picture of the underground rock formations. On the basis of this information the location of the first test well is decided.

results.title: The Search for meaning
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Norton
results.brief_description: Presented by Caroline Jones, whose compassionate questioning elicits responses of great honesty, this program features well-known Australians talking about their search for meaning. Guests include, Maina Gielgud - Artistic Director of the Australian Ballet; Stan Arneil - ex-prisoner-of- war; Rene Rivkin - business tycoon; ceramic artist Cybele Rowe; psychologist Dr. Ron Farmer; and naturopath, Dorothy Hall.

results.title: The Search for King Solomon's Mines for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette & cover in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description: The Search for King Solomon’s Mines [computer game] for Commodore 64. The Search for King Solomon’s Mines is a single-player text adventure for the Commodore 64. It is the first part of a two part graphic adventure and allows for saving of the adventure for pauses during play.

results.title: The Search for gravity waves
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Richard Smith
results.brief_description: Copied from an ABC Television broadcast on 5/12/90. Copyright reference number M007653T. When waves of gravity were fist predicted to be flooding the universe, they were thought to be undetectable. This program examines what gravity waves are, where they originate from, and how they are generated. Explores these and more questions including is a brief look at the effects on gravity of exploding supernovae, binary stars and the formation of black holes.
